item.description:
"I Have Seen the Future"

 

 We are thrilled to have many talented people in our group..., CT filmmaker - Lisa Seidenberg is one of them, come down and enjoy this documentary with us!

FREE

 

Filmmaker Lisa Seidenberg introduces her documentary -"I Have Seen the Future" a 2010 film focusing on the New York World's Fair of 1939.

Gliding as smoothly as a gleaming new Edsel from nostalgia to conspiracy theory, Seidenberg's film I Have Seen the Future shows how the New York World's Fair of 1939 led America and the world down a road of mass consumerism and a future dependent on the motorcar and the fuel to keep it going. The most spectacular project of Robert Moses, builder of roads and bridges, the World's Fair was a breathtaking vision of the future a vision that 70 years later, literally and figuratively ran out of fuel.

 Many baby boomers recall their childhood visits to the New York World's Fair in 1964-65 with great affection, but that was just the sequel to an even bigger and better international gathering on the same site in Flushing Meadow, Queens, 25 years earlier.

The New York World's Fair of 1939-40 was a flashier and racier event -- with "girlie" shows and a popular aquacade water ballet that bared more female and male flesh than was common at the time -- but it also served as a cultural bridge between the Great Depression and the boom times that would follow World War II. 

 

Read more: http://www.ctpost.com/default/article/I-Have-Seen-the-Future-film-revisits-1939-40-885366.php#ixzz1IlBnHtMO

More about Lisa Seidenberg can be found at: www.missmuffett.com

Info about library event: www.thefuture.eventbrite.com

Main library is across from Green, corner of Elm and Temple.

  

Just a heads up for tonight...

The film will take place on the second floor program room of the library.

Parking - Lot 51 on Temple Street across from the library - open to public at this hour and is free.  Coming off exit 3 Trumbull Street off 91 cross Whitney Avenue to next light, left onto Temple Street continue across Grove Street and Lot 51 is just ahead on the right.

We can have coffee after the film if you like at Blue State Coffee at 84 Wall Street which is conveniently located just through an alley way from Lot 51 parking lot.

http://www.bluestatecoffee.com/stores/new-haven-wall-street/
item.how_to_find_us: I will wear the BW scarf with piano keys
item.name: "I Have Seen the Future" - Film Screening
